attributes.action: Recognise that the revelations regarding Member's expenses have led the public to lose faith in their elected represntatives and this should be resolved by declaring a General Election
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The recent details of the nature and amount of claims under the current expenses policy applied to the House of Commons has resulted in a general loss of confidence in all Members by the electorate. 

We petition that this should be resolved by the public in a General Election. 

We also petition that to help rebuild the public confidence and to assist in the electorate's decision  the details of all expense claims made by all Members in the past 18 months will be made available to all the UK Press.

rejection.details: As explained in our terms and conditions (http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms), we cannot accept petitions which call upon the PM to "recognize" or "acknowledge" something, as they do not clearly call for a recognizable action.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
